alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 23 at 7:47PM MDT until June 24 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Several hours of single-digit relative humidity combined with breezy west winds will create elevated to locally critical fire weather conditions in the northeast highlands and central highlands Saturday afternoon and evening. Any fire starts will have the potential to spread rapidly in receptive fuel beds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands, (Zone 123) and Central Highlands (Zone 125) Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
